dt: {bc}to intersect for second or subsequent time

dt.t: A beautiful young student crosses and {wi}recrosses{/wi} his path …
These multiple storylines, all fascinating, cross and {wi}recross{/wi} in ways that expand the meanings of all of them …

dt: {bc}to return to a position with one part lying crosswise one over another

dt.t: He {wi}recrossed{/wi} his arms, looked away and refused to move.
He immediately sat down at the defense table to one side of the courtroom, crossing and {wi}recrossing{/wi} his legs with studied indifference.

dt: {bc}to traverse again {bc}to go again from one side to the other

dt.t: In this way did the restless shade of Captain H. C. Jorgenson {wi}recross{/wi} the water of oblivion to step back into the life of men.
As Mrs. Vincent Crummles {wi}recrossed{/wi} back to the table, there bounded on to the stage from some mysterious inlet, a little girl in a dirty white frock …

shortdef: to intersect for second or subsequent time
to return to a position with one part lying crosswise one over another
